Replying to @ 2019-09-23 23:33
@K16EInc @lauragift21 @css No. This is not about that. There is no client-side js required to render these pages. This is about making sure that a view is returned for requests to a URL even if that page has not yet finished being created by a static site generator. Serverless functions as a fallback.

Replying to @joaocarmona 2019-09-23 16:25
@joaocarmona @swyx Yeah, it's similar. But subtly different. Serverless Pre-Rendering is using functions to populate the CDN with the pages either after every request, or at a configured interval. My example assumes everything comes from the build. Only hitting a function if something 404s.
  • Permalink
  • Twitter
2019-09-23 16:17
To make this, I took a small pieces loosely joined approach, using: - @fauna - @eleven_ty - @Netlify + Netlify Functions ...but I'm not going to lie. My crowning glory is a smart-arsed 404 page using SVG in a needy attempt to make @sarah_edo proud. https://t.co/UO5nxczq1Y https://t.co/8mIzzG5Thi
  • Permalink
  • Twitter
Replying to @swyx 2019-09-23 16:13
@swyx @_Ezell_ @fauna That's right. The scenario is: Fulfil that URL immediately. And then make pre-render it and enhance it more later if needed (but then not in a time-critical context)
  • Permalink
  • Twitter
Replying to @_Ezell_ 2019-09-23 15:58
@_Ezell_ @swyx @fauna (once you start exploring it, it turns out to be beguilingly straightforward) ðŸ˜Š
  • Permalink
  • Twitter
Replying to @_Ezell_ 2019-09-23 15:55
@_Ezell_ @swyx It's agnostic of the SSG you are using, but effectively it's making use of custom 404 routing and serverless functions to query the underlying database (@fauna in this example) to get the page, while your automatic site regeneration completes. (No client-side js required)
  • Permalink
  • Twitter
2019-09-23 15:40
I made *a thing* so that I could play with using #serverless functions to render pages on the fly while a site deployment completes. You can play with it here: https://t.co/cabRetvg0X And you can read all about it on @css https://t.co/SvkrfrGP3k
